abstract: HSBC said on Wednesday that it planned to find an additional $2 billion to $3 billion in cost cuts by 2016 that would include the elimination of as many as 14,000 jobs.
snippet: HSBC said on Wednesday that it planned to find an additional $2 billion to $3 billion in cost cuts by 2016 that would include the elimination of as many as 14,000 jobs.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — After two years of far-reaching cost cuts and asset sales, HSBC said on Wednesday that it planned to find an additional $2 billion to $3 billion in savings by 2016 that would include the elimination of as many as 14,000 jobs.

headline.main: HSBC Plans More Job Cuts in Effort to Save Up to $3 Billion
